question: What is the dress code?
answer: The dress code is semi-formal/cocktail attire. We suggest suits or dress pants for men and cocktail dresses or dressy separates for women. Please avoid white, cream, or ivory as those are reserved for the bride.

question: Can I bring a plus one?
answer: Due to venue capacity, we can only accommodate guests who are specifically named on the invitation. Please refer to your invitation for details on who is invited.

question: Are children welcome?
answer: While we love your little ones, we have decided to make our wedding an adults-only celebration. We hope this gives you a chance to enjoy a night out!

question: What time should I arrive?
answer: We recommend arriving by 3:30 PM to allow time for parking and seating before the 4:00 PM ceremony. The ceremony will begin promptly.

question: Will the ceremony be indoors or outdoors?
answer: The ceremony will be held outdoors, weather permitting. We recommend bringing a light layer as evenings can be cool. In case of inclement weather, we have a backup plan.

question: Is there parking available?
answer: Yes, free parking is available on-site at the venue. Please follow the signs upon arrival to the designated parking area.

question: Will there be food and drinks?
answer: Yes! We will have a full dinner and open bar during the reception. Please let us know of any dietary restrictions in your RSVP.

question: Can I take photos during the ceremony?
answer: We kindly ask that you keep your phones and cameras put away during the ceremony so you can be fully present. Our photographer will capture all the special moments. Feel free to take photos during the reception!
